intro: Perdicium abyssinicum, commonly known as the Abyssinian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of this family. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Perdicium abyssinicum is also noted for its potential medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
